0.Pros: Management can be really good about scheduling.
0.Cons: Workload is rather large for minimum wage. And they are not helpful for getting a job afterwards.

1.Pros: very fast paced. many opportunities to contribute.
1.Cons: company going thru a organizational and cultural change.

2.Pros: Other coworkers are very interested in helping you. The schedule is pretty flexible. Free meals and all day drinks. Good for students (especially now since they pay upwards of $10 hourly and when I worked it was $8.)
2.Cons: Not so considerate of injuries and disabilities (in my experience,) a lot more than just flipping burgers....worth more than minimum wage. Some scheduling conflicts for students. Really long shifts, but not enough days.

3.Pros: I had a great experience and met a lot of great people.
3.Cons: Scheduling wasn't always accurate and had some conflicts.

4.Pros: The upgrades are getting better than in 2005
4.Cons: Its some what messy with bad employment

5.Pros: Had a great time working with team.
5.Cons: Don't really have any cons about this job.

6.Pros: everyone from the crew and management are very friendly, always greet me when I walk in the door, restrooms always clean with easy access.
6.Cons: food sometimes comes out cold or I have to wait a while for my food when it's supposed to be fast food

7.Pros: McDonalds itself is a great company to work for
7.Cons: The people they hire for that certain store isn't the right fit

8.Pros: There are no pros to this place. Find your minimum wage work elsewhere.
8.Cons: Ghetto, underpaid, overworked, rude customers, but management is worse.

9.Pros: None. The worst place to work at.
